message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DC, cs.SY

This paper discusses the development of a trust management model for securing IoT devices and relay nodes in a cloud-based infrastructure for neuroscience applications. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also utilizes an adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system (ANFIS) to estimate node behavioral trust and data trust, which falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper focuses on brain data and functions, which suggests a connection to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The use of cloud computing infrastructure implies a possible connection to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper deals with the management of trust in a communication network, which suggests a connection to cs.SY (Systems and Control).
